subject: Quantum Field Theory (TMP)
title: Quantenfeldtheorie (TUM, Module PH1008)
description: Core QFT concepts: path integrals and perturbation theory with Feynman diagrams; Green functions to cross sections via LSZ; renormalization, regularization, effective field theory, RG and running couplings; symmetries and relativistic fields with spin, fermionic path integrals, general Feynman rules; vector fields and gauge symmetry, QED. Workload 300 h (150 h contact), 10 ECTS, winter term. Version 2023w responsible: Beneke, Martin. Language: EN/DE.

goals.title: Quantum Field Theory – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner can set up path-integral QFT, compute perturbative amplitudes and Green functions, perform renormalization/RG, and quantize gauge theories including QED.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can set up path-integral QFT, compute perturbative amplitudes and Green functions, perform renormalization/RG, and quantize gauge theories including QED.

goals.title: Path Integrals & Feynman Diagrams
goals.description: Learner can formulate QFT in the path-integral approach, perform perturbative expansions, and build Feynman diagrams/rules.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can formulate QFT in the path-integral approach, perform perturbative expansions, and build Feynman diagrams/rules.

goals.title: Green Functions to Cross Sections
goals.description: Learner can relate Green functions to S-matrix elements and cross sections via LSZ and handle particle states in QFT.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can relate Green functions to S-matrix elements and cross sections via LSZ and handle particle states in QFT.

goals.title: Renormalization & RG
goals.description: Learner can regularize and renormalize perturbative QFT, use running couplings, and apply RG/improvement; understands EFT concepts.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can regularize and renormalize perturbative QFT, use running couplings, and apply RG/improvement; understands EFT concepts.

goals.title: Fields, Spin & Symmetries
goals.description: Learner can quantize relativistic fields with spin, set up fermionic path integrals, and derive Feynman rules respecting symmetries.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can quantize relativistic fields with spin, set up fermionic path integrals, and derive Feynman rules respecting symmetries.

goals.title: Gauge Fields & QED
goals.description: Learner can quantize vector fields with gauge symmetry, derive QED Feynman rules, and compute tree/loop processes in abelian and non-abelian settings.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can quantize vector fields with gauge symmetry, derive QED Feynman rules, and compute tree/loop processes in abelian and non-abelian settings.

descriptionEn: Core QFT concepts: path integrals and perturbation theory with Feynman diagrams; Green functions to cross sections via LSZ; renormalization, regularization, effective field theory, RG and running couplings; symmetries and relativistic fields with spin, fermionic path integrals, general Feynman rules; vector fields and gauge symmetry, QED. Workload 300 h (150 h contact), 10 ECTS, winter term. Version 2023w responsible: Beneke, Martin. Language: EN/DE.
